rename.from: INTERNAL ERROR: Black produced code that is not equivalent to the source #1212
rename.to: INTERNAL ERROR: Black produced code that is not equivalent to the source (in comments) #1212

body:
This is caused by the tab at the end of a line in the docstring:

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1324225/90248816-12a17380-de42-11ea-9449-4688e1a80a37.png)

---

Here's a minimal example (initial tabs replaced with spaces):

```python
def thing():
    """ 
    line ending in a tab	
    line ending with no whitespace
    """
```

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1324225/90248997-5f854a00-de42-11ea-8ee8-bd7af4025c9a.png)

---

Error does **not** occur with a tab at the end of the docstring:

```python
def thing():
    """ 
    line ending in a tab	
    """
```
And does **not** occur with a space at the end:

```python
def thing():
    """ 
    line ending in a space 
    line ending with no whitespace
    """
```

You're welcome! 

This is still a bug in Black, so we can keep it open to be investigated :)
`git bisect` points to a4c11a75e12300abfbe4c36854e450d42bdd1ee7 as the first bad commit, from "Re-indent the contents of docstrings" (#1053).
We can probably fix this by loosening the constraints on docstrings when we do the AST comparison, similar to what I did in #1593.

issue.title: Unstable formatting internal error for docstring with tabs

labels.name: R: duplicate
labels.description: This issue or pull request already exists

issue.body:
Just upgrade to 20.8b1. I get two internal error. In both cases I find in a docstring with tabs. Do not ask me why they are there. Someone in the past using a weird editor...

While I agree that there is no reason to keep the tabs, maybe black should not error out when replacing a tab with spaces?

**Case 1**
```
--- src
+++ dst
@@ -615,11 +615,11 @@
       body=
         Expr(
           value=
             Constant(
               value=
-                'Creates a column with datetime objects, either from datetime string or date string\nand time string columns\n\nArgs:\ndefault_time:\tTime to set for nan entries, False for no replacement',  # str
+                'Creates a column with datetime objects, either from datetime string or date string\nand time string columns\n\nArgs:\ndefault_time:   Time to set for nan entries, False for no replacement',  # str
             )  # /Constant
         )  # /Expr
         If(
           body=
             If(
```

```
def make_datetime_columns(report, datetime_col, date_col, time_col, default_time=False):
    """
    Creates a column with datetime objects, either from datetime string or date string
    and time string columns

    Args:
        default_time:	Time to set for nan entries, False for no replacement
    """
```

**Case 2**
```
--- src
+++ dst
@@ -7002,11 +7002,11 @@
           body=
             Expr(
               value=
                 Constant(
                   value=
-                    'Reports the actual and corrected hours for an activity.\nUse by the helper functions, compute_activity_hours and compute_duty_hours.\n\nArgs:\ntype:\t\tACTIVITY or DUTY\nACTIVITY sums by ACTIVITY_BEGIN and ACTIVITY_END\nDUTY sums by DUTY_BEGIN and DUTY_END\nactivity:   category for which the hours are computed, e.g., FLIGHT\nname:       specifies the column name of the result, e.g., BLOCK_HOURS\n\nReturns:\nNew data frame',  # str
+                    'Reports the actual and corrected hours for an activity.\nUse by the helper functions, compute_activity_hours and compute_duty_hours.\n\nArgs:\ntype:               ACTIVITY or DUTY\nACTIVITY sums by ACTIVITY_BEGIN and ACTIVITY_END\nDUTY sums by DUTY_BEGIN and DUTY_END\nactivity:   category for which the hours are computed, e.g., FLIGHT\nname:       specifies the column name of the result, e.g., BLOCK_HOURS\n\nReturns:\nNew data frame',  # str
                 )  # /Constant
             )  # /Expr
             Assign(
               targets=
                 Name(
```

```
    def compute_hours(self, type, activity, name):
        """
        Reports the actual and corrected hours for an activity.
        Use by the helper functions, compute_activity_hours and compute_duty_hours.

        Args:
            type:		ACTIVITY or DUTY
                        ACTIVITY sums by ACTIVITY_BEGIN and ACTIVITY_END
                        DUTY sums by DUTY_BEGIN and DUTY_END
            activity:   category for which the hours are computed, e.g., FLIGHT
            name:       specifies the column name of the result, e.g., BLOCK_HOURS

        Returns:
            New data frame
        """
```

issue.title: INTERNAL ERROR when formatting docstrings containing literal tab characters

labels.name: R: duplicate
labels.description: This issue or pull request already exists

issue.body:
**To Reproduce**

`black-repro-tabs.py`:
```python
class C:
    """
    Words	With	Tabs
    """
    pass
```

```
(venv38) jreese@garbodor ~/scratch Â» black --diff --safe black-repro-tabs.py
error: cannot format black-repro-tabs.py: INTERNAL ERROR: Black produced code that is not equivalent to the source.  Please report a bug on https://github.com/psf/black/issues.  This diff might be helpful: /var/folders/_b/6gpzshq548d4d_4bk1m5sq280000gn/T/blk_epxedyba.log
Oh no! ðŸ’¥ ðŸ’” ðŸ’¥
1 file would fail to reformat.
```

```
(venv38) jreese@garbodor ~/scratch â€¹123â€º Â» cat /var/folders/_b/6gpzshq548d4d_4bk1m5sq280000gn/T/blk_epxedyba.log
--- src
+++ dst
@@ -5,11 +5,11 @@
       body=
         Expr(
           value=
             Constant(
               value=
-                'Words\tWith\tTabs',  # str
+                'Words       With    Tabs',  # str
             )  # /Constant
         )  # /Expr
         Pass(
         )  # /Pass
       decorator_list=
```

**Expected behavior** 

Should be formatted using consistent tab characters (or replaced with spaces? ðŸ¤·) on both passes.

**Environment (please complete the following information):**

- Version: 20.8b1
- OS and Python version: Python 3.8.5 on Linux and 

Does this bug also happen on master?** 

Yes. 

**Additional context** 

 @thatch says `git bisect` points to a4c11a75e12300abfbe4c36854e450d42bdd1ee7 where docstring formatting was introduced.

body:
Updated (again), sorry for the noise.

Confirming a duplicate like #1638 (which may be a different but related issue in black 20.8b1)

issue.title: Fix style for the latest release of Black

repository.name: integrations-core
repository.description: Core integrations of the Datadog Agent

issue.body:
### What does this PR do?
<!-- A brief description of the change being made with this pull request. -->
The new release of black broke master style https://pypi.org/project/black/#history

### Motivation
<!-- What inspired you to submit this pull request? -->

### Additional Notes
<!-- Anything else we should know when reviewing? -->

### Review checklist (to be filled by reviewers)

- [ ] Feature or bugfix MUST have appropriate tests (unit, integration, e2e)
- [ ] PR title must be written as a CHANGELOG entry [(see why)](https://github.com/DataDog/integrations-core/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#pull-request-title)
- [ ] Files changes must correspond to the primary purpose of the PR as described in the title (small unrelated changes should have their own PR)
- [ ] PR must have `changelog/` and `integration/` labels attached

issue.title: "INTERNAL ERROR: Black produced different code on the second pass of the formatter"

labels.name: C: unstable formatting
labels.description: Formatting changed on the second pass

labels.name: F: parentheses
labels.description: Too many parentheses, not enough parentheses, and so on.

issue.body:
- Version: 20.8b0
- OS and Python version: all

This is a rare problem that we're currently investigating. The most common case of it has to do with a combination of magic trailing commas and optional parentheses. Long story short, there's this behavior:

- Black now treats all pre-existing trailing magic commas found in bracket pairs as signal to explode that bracket pair (e.g. to format it "one element per line");
- in other places Black inserts trailing commas itself after reformatting a long expression or statement;
- then on another run, Black finds those trailing commas and treats them as pre-existing trailing commas that signal that the given bracket pair should be exploded.

The expected behavior is that there should be no difference between the first formatting and the second formatting. In practice Black sometimes chooses for or against optional parentheses differently depending on whether the line should be exploded or not. This is what needs fixing.

## Workaround
We're working on fixing this, until then, format the file twice with `--fast`, it will keep its formatting moving forward.

## Call To Action
If you find a case of this, please attach the generated log here so we can investigate. We've already added three identifying examples of this as expected failures to https://github.com/psf/black/pull/1627/commits/25206d8cc6e98143f0b10bcbe9e8b41b8b543abe.

Finally, if you're interested in debugging this yourself, look for `should_explode` in `if` statements in the Black codebase. Those are the decisions that lead to unstable formatting.

issue.title: Black removes tabs from within docstrings and thus not equivalent to the source

labels.name: R: duplicate
labels.description: This issue or pull request already exists

issue.body:
**Describe the bug**

I got this error when formatting MAAS code.

```
error: cannot format src/provisioningserver/drivers/pod/virsh.py: INTERNAL ERROR: Black produced code that is not equivalent to the source.  Please report a bug on https://github.com/psf/black/issues.  This diff might be helpful: /tmp/blk__oj12ra3.log
Oh no! ðŸ’¥ ðŸ’” ðŸ’¥
1 file failed to reformat.
```
The diff contains...

```
--- src
+++ dst
@@ -17834,11 +17834,11 @@
           body=
             Expr(
               value=
                 Constant(
                   value=
-                    'Calculate a block name based on the `idx`.\n\nDrive#  Name\n0\t    vda\n25\t    vdz\n26\t    vdaa\n27\t    vdab\n51\t    vdaz\n52\t    vdba\n53\t    vdbb\n701\t    vdzz\n702\t    vdaaa\n703\t    vdaab\n18277   vdzzz',  # str
+                    'Calculate a block name based on the `idx`.\n\nDrive#  Name\n0           vda\n25          vdz\n26          vdaa\n27          vdab\n51          vdaz\n52          vdba\n53          vdbb\n701         vdzz\n702         vdaaa\n703         vdaab\n18277   vdzzz',  # str
                 )  # /Constant
             )  # /Expr
             Assign(
               targets=
                 Name(
```

**To Reproduce** Steps to reproduce the behavior:

1. Take this file https://github.com/maas/maas/blob/6620973/src/provisioningserver/drivers/pod/virsh.py
1.1. `wget https://raw.githubusercontent.com/maas/maas/6620973567f4081a4c5ada8ea2720dc079c0f23d/src/provisioningserver/drivers/pod/virsh.py`
2. Run _Black_ on it with just the filename
2.1 `black virsh.py`
3. See error above

**Expected behavior**

It looks like black is changing tabs within the docstring, I wouldn't expect this to happen.

**Environment (please complete the following information):**

- Version: 20.8.b1 (and tested on master which was 2b75f88 at the time)
- OS and Python version: Ubuntu and Python 3.8.4 (and also tested 3.8.2 on another ubuntu box)

**Does this bug also happen on master?**

Yes, confirmed with `pip install git+https://github.com/psf/black` in a virtualenv

body:
Note that the bug also occurs when there's a literal tab in the middle of a line. It seems black converts that to spaces and errors out.

```python
def foo():
    """
    a	b  # it's a literal tab between a and b
    """
    pass
```

```console
$ black foo.py
error: cannot format foo.py: INTERNAL ERROR: Black produced code that is not equivalent to the source.  Please report a bug on https://github.com/psf/black/issues.  This diff might be helpful: /tmp/blk_q5uiqxs8.log
Oh no! ðŸ’¥ ðŸ’” ðŸ’¥
1 file failed to reformat.
```

The contents of `/tmp/blk_q5uiqxs8.log`

```diff
--- src
+++ dst
@@ -23,11 +23,11 @@
       body=
         Expr(
           value=
             Constant(
               value=
-                "a\tb  # it's a literal tab between a and b",  # str
+                "a   b  # it's a literal tab between a and b",  # str
             )  # /Constant
         )  # /Expr
         Pass(
         )  # /Pass
       decorator_list=
```

Note also the bug only occurs with a multiline docstring:
This fails:
```python
def f(p):
    """p:	Parameter
    """
    pass
```
This passes:
```python
def f(p):
    """p:	Parameter"""
    pass
```

issue.title: When doc string contains tab, black formatting fails.

labels.name: R: duplicate
labels.description: This issue or pull request already exists

issue.body:
When running black on method which doc string has tab in the middle of the string, black says: 
```
error: cannot format black_example.py: INTERNAL ERROR: Black produced code that is not equivalent to the source. 
```

**To Reproduce** Steps to reproduce the behavior:

1. Take this [file](https://gist.github.com/aaltat/35d64602735e6019f0599a8cf0e4eb92#file-black_example-py), which has tab in between `foobar`and `is` words. 
2. Run black with command: `black black_example.py`
3. See error
```
error: cannot format balck_example.py: INTERNAL ERROR: Black produced code that is not equivalent to the source.  Please report a bug on https://github.com/psf/black/issues.  This diff might be helpful: C:\Users\user\AppData\Local\Temp\blk_gf63oczm.log
```
In the log file I see:
```
--- src
+++ dst
@@ -24,11 +24,11 @@
       body=
         Expr(
           value=
             Constant(
               value=
-                'Something\nfoobar\tis other',  # str
+                'Something\nfoobar      is other',  # str
             )  # /Constant
         )  # /Expr
         Pass(
         )  # /Pass
       decorator_list=
```

**Expected behavior**
Did expect black to format tab to spaces correctly.

**Environment (please complete the following information):**

- Version: 20.8b1
- OS and Python version: Windows 10, Python 3.8.1

**Does this bug also happen on master?**
Yes, tried with the online formatter. 

**Additional context**
This looks like a regression, because error is not displayed in the 19,x release.

body:
This appears to be caused by the intentional decision (introduced in #1053) to expand tabs to space (using `tabsize=8``, which is the [expandtabs()](https://docs.python.org/3.8/library/stdtypes.html#str.expandtabs) default):

https://github.com/psf/black/blob/6dddbd72414061cde9dd8ee72eac373b7fcf8b54/src/black/__init__.py#L6745-L6747

issue.title: Tab in docstring gives non equivalent result

labels.name: R: duplicate
labels.description: This issue or pull request already exists

issue.body:
**Describe the bug** A clear and concise description of what the bug is.
Tab in docstring give non equivalent result


**To Reproduce** Steps to reproduce the behavior:
```
def foo():
    """
    [1] 	tmp
    """
    pass
```


**Expected behavior** A clear and concise description of what you expected to happen.
That it does not give an error. 

**Environment (please complete the following information):**
Not important

**Does this bug also happen on master?** To answer this, you have two options:
[black.now.sh](https://black.now.sh/?version=master&state=_Td6WFoAAATm1rRGAgAhARYAAAB0L-Wj4ACIAFVdAD2IimZxl1N_WlbvK5V9KEd0suDTtKdXyRPNp3_8BJfVOeb_JVqI6J_dzVM5106__0buDDcHy5cwOTIkCGHSn4Wh84VlREhUlSU7DqOz1yUxwOY8fUYAAAAA7kxl1-lHtWkAAXGJAQAAAD-_YQexxGf7AgAAAAAEWVo=)
```
INTERNAL ERROR: Black produced code that is not equivalent to the source.  Please report a bug on https://github.com/psf/black/issues.  This diff might be helpful: /tmp/blk_54c3klr3.log

--- src
+++ dst
@@ -16,11 +16,11 @@
       body=
         Expr(
           value=
             Constant(
               value=
-                '[1] \ttmp',  # str

         )  # /Pass
       decorator_list=
```

issue.title: Correctly handle inline tabs in docstrings
issue.body:
The `fix_docstring` function expanded all tabs, which caused a
difference in the AST representation when those tabs were inline and not
leading. This changes the function to only expand leading tabs so inline
tabs are preserved.

Fixes #1601.

issue.title: cannot format jaraco.classes.ancestry
issue.body:
**Describe the bug** A clear and concise description of what the bug is.

Running `black` on jaraco/jaraco.classes@a5ee6c53463cc1d468cde1784de70c862e3989c2 fails with:

```
error: cannot format /Users/jaraco/code/main/jaraco.classes/jaraco/classes/ancestry.py: INTERNAL ERROR: Black produced code that is not equivalent to the source.  Please report a bug on https://github.com/psf/black/issues.  This diff might be helpful: /var/folders/c6/v7hnmq453xb6p2dbz1gqc6rr0000gn/T/blk_wez_xks5.log
```

Log says:

```diff
--- src
+++ dst
@@ -192,11 +192,11 @@
           value=
             Constant(
               kind=
                 None,  # NoneType
               value=
-                "Generator over all subclasses of a given class, in depth-first order.\n\n>>> bool in list(iter_subclasses(int))\nTrue\n>>> class A(object): pass\n>>> class B(A): pass\n>>> class C(A): pass\n>>> class D(B,C): pass\n>>> class E(D): pass\n>>>\n>>> for cls in iter_subclasses(A):\n...\t\tprint(cls.__name__)\nB\nD\nE\nC\n>>> # get ALL classes currently defined\n>>> res = [cls.__name__ for cls in iter_subclasses(object)]\n>>> 'type' in res\nTrue\n>>> 'tuple' in res\nTrue\n>>> len(res) > 100\nTrue",  # str
+                "Generator over all subclasses of a given class, in depth-first order.\n\n>>> bool in list(iter_subclasses(int))\nTrue\n>>> class A(object): pass\n>>> class B(A): pass\n>>> class C(A): pass\n>>> class D(B,C): pass\n>>> class E(D): pass\n>>>\n>>> for cls in iter_subclasses(A):\n...         print(cls.__name__)\nB\nD\nE\nC\n>>> # get ALL classes currently defined\n>>> res = [cls.__name__ for cls in iter_subclasses(object)]\n>>> 'type' in res\nTrue\n>>> 'tuple' in res\nTrue\n>>> len(res) > 100\nTrue",  # str
             )  # /Constant
         )  # /Expr
         Return(
           value=
             Call(
```

**To Reproduce** Steps to reproduce the behavior:

1. git clone https://github.com/jaraco/jaraco.classes
2. cd jaraco.classes
3. git checkout a5ee6c53463cc1d468cde1784de70c862e3989c2
4. black .

**Environment (please complete the following information):**

- Version: 20.8b1
- OS and Python version: macOS 10.15

Yes

```

Please report a bug on https://github.com/psf/black/issues.  This diff might be helpful: /var/folders/c6/v7hnmq453xb6p2dbz1gqc6rr0000gn/T/blk_c3ygngeb.log

```
